intro: Suaeda helenae, commonly known as Helen's saltbush, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in dry environments. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in summer, typically in clusters at the ends of branches. It is well adapted to saline soils and can thrive in coastal areas with high salt content. Suaeda helenae is often found in desert scrublands and is an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
